thread.title: Alec Baldwin Trolls Trump With Russian-Ganguage #MAGA Baseball Cap
thread.title_full: Alec Baldwin Trolls Trump With Russian-Ganguage #MAGA Baseball Cap

title: Alec Baldwin Trolls Trump With Russian-Ganguage #MAGA Baseball Cap
text:
Https%3a%2f%2fblueprint-api-production.s3.amazonaws.com%2fuploads%2fstory%2fthumbnail%2f32836%2f96a8a2ee-3e37-483f-b7ea-636999f70cba More From Saturday Night Live to social media, Alec Baldwin has seemingly perfected the art of trolling Donald Trump. Most recently, the actor posted a selfie to Instagram featuring a Russian-language "Make America Great Again" cap, a clear reference to the president-elect's continued praise of Russian president Vladimir Putin as well as his skepticism that Russian hacking affected election results in November. SEE ALSO: You can take the subway, but you can't hide from Donald Trump's face According to a translation provided to Mashable by Olga Massov, the hat literally says "Make America Cool Again" — but it's obviously intended to be a mocking take on Trump's famous "MAGA" slogan. Shortly after Baldwin's joke, Trump released even more contentious tweets about Russia. On Saturday morning, he tweeted that "having a good relationship with Russia would be a good thing, not a bad thing," and that only "stupid people" would believe the opposite. Having a good relationship with Russia is a good thing, not a bad thing. Only "stupid" people, or fools, would think that it is bad! We 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 7, 2017 have enough problems around the world without yet another one. When I am President, Russia will respect us far more than they do now and.... 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 7, 2017 both countries will, perhaps, work together to solve some of the many great and pressing problems and issues of the WORLD! 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 7, 2017 The U.S. intelligence community believes Russia was behind cyberattacks targeting the Democratic Party throughout the election season. A report released Friday by U.S. intelligence agencies reasserted that, at the very least, Russian President Vladimir Putin wanted a Donald Trump presidency. You know, just like on SNL. BONUS: Ridiculous Fox anchor to Teen Vogue writer: 'stick to the thigh-high boots'
